content: दुष् {c4c} <ab>P.</ab> (दुष्यति, दुष्ट) {@--1@} To be bad or corrupted, be spoiled or suffer damage. {@--2@} To be defiled or violated (as a woman &c.), be stained, be or become impure or contaminated; <ls>Pt. 1. 66</ls>; <ls>Ms. 7. 24</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">9. 318</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">10. 102.</ls> {@--3@} To sin, commit a mistake, be wrong. {@--4@} To be unchaste or faithless. {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} (दूषयति-ते, but दूषयति-ते or दोषयति-ते in the sense of ‘making depraved’ or ‘corrupting’) {@--1@} To corrupt, spoil, cause to perish, hurt, destroy, defile, taint, contaminate, vitiate, pollute (<ab>lit.</ab> and <ab>fig.</ab>); न भीतो मरणादस्मि केवलं दूषितं यशः <ls>Mk. 10. 27</ls>; पुरा दूषयति स्थलीं <ls>R. 12. 30</ls>, <ls n="R.">8. 68</ls>, <ls n="R.">10. 47</ls>, <ls n="R.">12. 4</ls>; <ls>Ms. 5. 1</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 5.">104</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">7. 195</ls>; <ls>Y. 1. 189</ls>; <ls>Amaru. 70</ls>; न त्वेवं दूषयिष्यामि शस्त्रग्रहमहाव्रतं <ls>Mv. 3. 8</ls> ‘shall not sully, violate or break &c.’ {@--2@} To corrupt the morals, demoralize. {@--3@} To violate or dishonour (as a girl or another's wife); <ls>Ms. 8. 364</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 8.">368.</ls> {@--4@} To abrogate, rescind, annul. {@--5@} To blame, censure, find fault with, speak ill of, accuse; दूषितः सर्वलोकेषु निषादत्वं गमिष्यति <ls>Rām.</ls>; <ls>Y. 1. 66.</ls> {@--6@} To adulterate. {@--7@} To falsify. {@--8@} To refute, disprove.
